titlestmt.titleproper: Federal Theater Project (Conn.) records of Gertrude DonDero

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:11:53 -0400.

did.unittitle: Federal Theater Project (Conn.) records of Gertrude DonDero

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Programs of plays produced by the FTP in Connecticut, 1936-1937; and lists, press clippings, and photographs regarding the work of Gertrude DonDero.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel NDA1 available for use at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals returned to Gertrude DonDero after microfilming.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Federal Theater Project papers also at Syracuse University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Federal Theater Project (FTP) was a program established under the Federal Project No. One of the Works Progress Administration (WPA) in 1935. It sought to create employment for actors and others involved in the performing arts during the Depression. Gertrude DonDero was the state director of the Connecticut Federal Theater Project.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Lent for microfilming 1964 by Gertrude DonDero.
